result.execSummary:
The defendant William J Feavel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program only after 18 months of incarceration.   Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.   7/12/22  COURT GRANTS 43 DAYS CREDIT IF REVOKED.

miscConds.notes: Standard court costs waived.  DNA Surcharge is to be paid as a condition of probation.

AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended. Maintain absolute sobriety. Comply with random urine screens.  NO use or possession of CBD or vaping products.  
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia.  No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.

Full physiological evaluation and comply with any treatment.    Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  

No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).  Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.  Comply with all drivers licensing restrictions.  

Attend a Victim Impact Panel in Waukesha County within 6 months of release from custody, and attend EVERY Victim Impact Panel while on extended supervision.  Attend 2 self help meetings per week in person.  

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM duration is until further order of the Court. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM.   Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.
